content.p: Using the above description of regulation of cell number, try to answer these questions to apply the feedback cycle concept.

question.body: What would be comparable to a variable in this scenario?

response.feedback: Correct. The number of cells would be the variable that is being monitored and needs to be regulated in different situations.
Incorrect. Cell-to-cell connections allow cells to communicate with one another.
Incorrect. Internal and nuclear signals allow a cell to regulate its cell division/replication cycle.
Incorrect. Proliferation (an increase in cell number) and apoptosis (decrease in cell number) are not the variable.
Incorrect. Individual cells are involved in the feedback cycle, but the cell itself would not the variable.

question.body: What is functioning as the receptor, detecting changes in the environment?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The cell number is what is being regulated.
Incorrect. The cell to cell connections would best be considered a method of communication.
Incorrect. This is probably not the best answer here, as this might best be considered a method of communication.
Incorrect. Proliferation (an increase in cell number) and apoptosis (decrease in cell number) are not the receptors.
Correct. The cells are sensing their environment and probably best represent a receptor in this scenario.
Incorrect. The number of cells is the variable, not the control center.
Incorrect. This is not the best answer as cell to cell connections probably best represent a method of communication.
Incorrect. Internal chemical and genetic signals determine the metabolic response, but this is not the best answer.
Incorrect. The control center is where the change is processed; proliferation or apoptosis are the effects of the change.
Correct. The cell not only senses its environment, it then responds by initiating the process of proliferation or apoptosis.
